title: Prime power coverings of groups
authors: Michael Giudici, Luke Morgan, Cheryl E. Praeger
abstract:
For a finite group $A$ with normal subgroup $G$, a subgroup $U$ of $G$ is an
$A$-prime-power-covering subgroup if $U$ meets every $A$-conjugacy-class of
elements of $G$ of prime power order. It is conjectured that $|G:U|$ is bounded
by some function of $|A:G|$, and this conjecture has number theoretic
implications for relative Brauer groups of algebraic number fields. We prove
the conjecture in the case that the action of $G$ on the set of right cosets of
$U$ in $G$ is innately transitive. This includes the case where $U$ is a
maximal subgroup of $G$. The proof uses a new bound on the order of a
nonabelian finite simple group in terms of its number of classes of elements of
prime power order, which in turn depends on the Classification of the Finite
Simple Groups.
